alert.note: Alert for Columbus; Inland Brunswick; Inland New Hanover (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wilmington (Northeastern South Carolina and Southeastern North Carolina - Wilmington)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 06 at 10:40PM EDT by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of west central New Hanover, northeastern Brunswick and east central Columbus Counties through 1115 PM EDT... At 1038 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Batarora, or 8 miles west of Leland, moving southeast at 5 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Wilmington, Leland, Northwest, Bishop, Batarora, Mill Creek, Town Creek, Phoenix, Delco, Riegelwood, Winnabow, University Of North Carolina At Wilmington, Hightsville, Belville, Navassa, Sandy Creek and New Hanover Regional Medical Center. This includes US Route 17 in Brunswick County between mile markers 33 and 44. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Occasional to frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.

area.areaDesc: Columbus; Inland Brunswick; Inland New Hanover
